summary.span: Represents a managed object designed to work with the Oracle data type.

span.span: Represents a managed object designed to work with the Oracle data type.

summary.span: This class cannot be inherited.

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Oracle`BFILE`資料類型是一種 Oracle`LOB`資料類型，包含最大值 4 gb 之二進位資料的參考。The Oracle `BFILE` data type is an Oracle `LOB` data type that contains a reference to binary data with a maximum size of 4 gigabytes. Oracle`BFILE`不同於其他 Oracle`LOB`資料類型，因為其資料會儲存在伺服器上的實體檔案而不是作業系統中。An Oracle `BFILE` differs from other Oracle `LOB` data types in that its data is stored in a physical file in the operating system instead of on the server. 請注意，`BFILE`資料類型提供唯讀存取資料。Note that the `BFILE` data type provides read-only access to data. 因此，寫入導向的方法繼承自類別不支援。Therefore, write-oriented methods inherited from the class are not supported. 其他特性`BFILE`資料類型，使其有別`LOB`資料類型包括：Other characteristics of a `BFILE` data type that distinguish it from a `LOB` data type are that it: - 包含非結構化資料。Contains unstructured data. - 支援伺服器端區塊。Supports server-side chunking. - 使用參考複製語意。Uses reference copy semantics. 例如，如果您在執行複製作業`BFILE`，則僅`BFILE`複製 （也就是檔案的參考） 的定位器。For example, if you perform a copy operation on a `BFILE`, only the `BFILE` locator (which is a reference to the file) is copied. 而不會複製檔案中的資料。The data in the file is not copied. `BFILE`資料類型應該用於參考`LOB`的太大，因此不實際儲存在資料庫中。The `BFILE` data type should be used for referencing `LOB`s that are large in size, and therefore, not practical to store in the database. 會使用用戶端、 伺服器及通訊額外負荷`BFILE`資料類型相較於`LOB`資料型別。There is client, server, and communication overhead for using a `BFILE` data type compared to the `LOB` data type. 若要存取更有效率`BFILE`如果您只需要取得少量的資料。It is more efficient to access a `BFILE` if you only need to obtain a small amount of data. 它是更有效率的方式存取資料庫內建`LOB`s，如果您需要取得整個物件。It is more efficient to access database-resident `LOB`s if you need to obtain the entire object. 每個非 NULL物件會定義基礎實體檔案的位置的兩個實體與關聯：Each non-NULL object is associated with two entities that define the location of the underlying physical file: - Oracle DIRECTORY 物件 (檔案系統中目錄的資料庫別名) 及An Oracle DIRECTORY object, which is a database alias for a directory in the file system, and - 基礎實體檔案的檔名 (位於與 DIRECTORY 物件相關聯的目錄中)。The file name of the underlying physical file, which is located in the directory associated with the DIRECTORY object. 在後`BFILE`會建立，您可以擷取的形式在其定位器物件使用或方法。After a `BFILE` is created, you can retrieve its locator in the form of an object using the or methods. 若要取得物件，請呼叫方法。To obtain an object, call the method. 實體檔案，的物件具有不需要存在，直到您嘗試存取它。The physical file that an object is associated with does not need to exist until you attempt to access it. 應用程式可以繫結不存在的檔案，請在預期的位置，建立實體檔案，然後呼叫。An application can bind an to a nonexistent file, create the physical file in the expected location, and then call . 任何嘗試存取已關閉使用或是方法再次開啟自動串流。Any attempt to access a closed using the or methods reopens an stream automatically. 下列 C# 範例示範如何建立`BFILE`在 Oracle 資料表，然後再擷取它的形式物件。The following C# example demonstrates how you can create a `BFILE` in an Oracle table, and then retrieve it in the form of an object. 此範例示範如何使用物件和和方法。The example demonstrates the use of the object and the and methods. [!code-csharp[DataWorks OracleClient.BFile#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/DataWorks OracleClient.BFile/CS/source.cs#1)] 如需有關建立和使用 Oracle `BFILE`，請參閱 Oracle 文件中的適當主題。For more information about creating and using an Oracle `BFILE`, see the appropriate topic in your Oracle documentation. > [!NOTE] > `BeginWrite`， `EndWrite`，並`WriteByte`方法，繼承自`System.IO.Stream`類別中，不支援，因為`BFILE`資料類型是唯讀的。The `BeginWrite`, `EndWrite`, and `WriteByte` methods, which are inherited from the `System.IO.Stream` class, are not supported because the `BFILE` data type is read-only.

summary.span: Creates a copy of this object associated with the same physical file as the original.

span.span: Creates a copy of this object associated with the same physical file as the original.

returns.span: A new object associated with the same physical file as the original object.

span.span: A new object associated with the same physical file as the original object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 新屬性物件一開始會有相同的原始物件的值。The properties of the new object initially have the same values as those of the original object. 不過之後,完畢之後，每個與其他物件無關。However, after the is complete, each object is independent from the other. 比方說，變更的值原始屬性的值不變更複本。For example, changing the value of the property on the original does not change the value of on the copy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 基礎資料類型的來源和目的地必須相容。The underlying data types of the source and the destination must be compatible. 比方說，您無法將二進位資料複製到目的地具有字元資料類型。For example, you cannot copy binary data to a destination that has a character data type. 您必須有寫入權限到目的地針對正確執行的作業。You must have write access to the destination for the operation to execute correctly.

summary.span: Represents a null object that is not bound to a physical file.

span.span: Represents a null object that is not bound to a physical file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 當您想要在執行比對作業時很有用來決定 null 屬性。 can be useful when you want to perform a comparison operation on an to determine nullability. 任何嘗試執行讀取的作業物件成功，但不會傳回任何資料。Any attempt to perform a read operation on a object succeeds, but does not return any data. 任何嘗試執行寫入作業物件產生例外狀況。Any attempt to perform a write operation on a object generates an exception. 選取`BFILE`包含 null 值的資料行會傳回。Selecting a `BFILE` column that contains a null value returns .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 不支援搜尋超過資料流長度的任何位置。Seeking to any location beyond the length of the stream is not supported. `Position`屬性不會不追蹤的資料流中已使用，略過，或兩者的位元組數目。The `Position` property does not keep track of the number of bytes from the stream that have been consumed, skipped, or both.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性會讀取整個`BFILE`一次。The property reads the entire `BFILE` at one time. > [!NOTE] > 使用的優點`BFILE`s 是擷取大量的資料區塊 （chunk），在用戶端的能力。A benefit of using `BFILE`s is the ability to retrieve large amounts of data in chunks at the client. 不過，當您使用，您會取得 BFILE 資料行的所有資料，作為一個連續的區塊，可能會大幅增加應用程式的額外負荷。However, when you use , you obtain all the data for the BFILE column as one contiguous chunk, which can significantly increase application overhead.

exception.span: The exception that is thrown when an invoked method is not supported, or when there is an attempt to read, seek, or write to a stream that does not support the invoked functionality.
